Class CDService

java.lang.Object
application.CDService
public class CDService extends Object
Application layer service for Compact Discs (CD) handling borrow/return operations and overdue fine calculation. This class focuses ONLY on CD business rules:

Borrow period: 7 days.
Overdue fine: 20 NIS per day (applied once the due date has passed).

It delegates persistence concerns to CDRepository and LoanRepository.

  • Constructor Details

    • CDService

      public CDService()

  • Method Details

    • borrowCD

      public Loan borrowCD(Member member, String cdId, LocalDate borrowDate)
      Borrows a CD by its id for the given member starting on borrowDate. Creates and stores a Loan instance bound to the CD and member.
      Parameters:
      member - the borrowing member (must not be null and must be allowed to borrow)
      cdId - the CD identifier (must exist in repository)
      borrowDate - the start date of borrowing
      Returns:
      the created Loan object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if arguments are null or CD does not exist
      IllegalStateException - if member cannot borrow or CD already borrowed

    • returnCD

      public double returnCD(Member member, String cdId, LocalDate returnDate)
      Returns a previously borrowed CD, computing any overdue fine at the given returnDate.
      Parameters:
      member - the member returning the CD
      cdId - identifier of the CD to return
      returnDate - the date the CD is being returned
      Returns:
      the calculated fine (0 if not overdue)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if arguments are null or active loan not found

    • getActiveLoan

      public Loan getActiveLoan(Member member, String cdId)
      Retrieves the active (non-returned) loan for a given member and CD id.
      Parameters:
      member - the member
      cdId - the cd identifier
      Returns:
      active loan or null if none

    • previewFine

      public double previewFine(Member member, String cdId, LocalDate today)
      Computes the potential overdue fine for a currently active CD loan as of 'today' WITHOUT marking it returned.
      Parameters:
      member - the member owning the loan
      cdId - cd identifier
      today - evaluation date
      Returns:
      fine amount or 0.0 if no active loan or not overdue
